sn55.9:1.2: “Sir, the monk named Asoka has passed away.
sn55.9:1.3: Where has he been reborn in his next life?
sn55.9:1.6: and the laywoman named Asokā have passed away.
sn55.9:1.7: Where have they been reborn in the next life?”
sn55.9:2.1: “Ānanda, the monk Asoka passed away having realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life …
sn55.9:2.2: (And all is explained as in SN 55.8)
sn55.9:3.1: This is that mirror of the teaching.
sn55.9:3.2: A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:
sn55.9:3.3: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’”
